file_content.text: Identifying? Colony Control systems locked down. Enter code! Remote access in progress.
No Hunter, but a lot of really weird tech. Hate to say it, but maybe we should call your bosses.
The machinery is a parasite, clinging to the colony controls. If Hunter was here, we think we should call our superiors.
I don't recognize any of this equipment. If Hunter set it up, we should probably contact headquarters so we don't... I don't know, blow up the colony.
I've never seen technology like this. Some sort of override box connected to the machine... your SIS friend must have set it up.
We'll have to create a link up to headquarters. I don't fancy electrocuting myself without expert opinions.
Isen Four colony to Imperial Intelligence headquarters. Secure routing. This is Cipher Nine--there's some sort of device here....
Cipher Nine? I got your report, but we can barely read you. What's going on?
I haven't found Hunter, but he left his mark on the control center.
Still looking for our target.
Most of the colonists are dead, and the control center is a wreck. Hunter might be responsible.
This place is a disaster.
Right now, I need you to focus and help me find Hunter.
Don't ask stupid questions.
I'm linked into the colony's communications relay. Strange tech interference... Fixers don't recognize it, but I can shut it down....
You followed me. You cut off control. I'm a little put out.
Not that it really matters. I'm long gone, I got my massacre and besides--it was for propriety more than anything.
What do you mean? Who ordered the colony destroyed?
You killed these people?
Were you this obnoxious to Ardun Kothe? Or am I special?
Arrogant as always.
I tried to behave for the SIS--but for you and me?--let's be bad.
We have unfinished business. Leave the tech behind and face me.
Show yourself in person.
Generous offer, but I'm going to say "no."
Look, I don't have anything against that place. But if you want a war to start right, you've got to grease the wheels.
When the Republic hears that the Empire slaughtered thousands of colonists who surrendered? There won't be any more "peaceful resolutions."
Why make this conflict bloodier than it has to be?
You want more violence.
I'm making the war exactly as bloody as it has to be.
You're not doing this for the SIS, and you're not doing it alone.
Tell me who's behind this.
Innocent people are dead. Republic citizens--your people!
You're sick.
Touchy, aren't you? Did I hit a nerve?
Time for me to go. And you need to stop coming after me, "Cipher Nine."
Because without anonymity, you won't last long--and I can make your operations very public.
Blast. I couldn't trace him... I'll pull what I can from the machinery, but he's more right than he knows. The survivors are a problem.
How do the survivors pose a threat?
What do you mean?
These people surrendered before, and they're half-dead. They won't be trouble.
The colonists are harmless.
As soon as word gets out what happened, other worlds we've captured will rebel.
Watchers Seven and Nine are... strategizing. They recommend eliminating the survivors on Isen Four so the news of the massacre is contained.
The colonists are a resource we can still exploit. We just need them under control.
We should make use of them.
What you're suggesting is unconscionable.
I won't kill them.
You activated the Eradicators once. This is a chance to save Imperial lives at the cost of Republic ones.
Then our troops will waste time putting down bloody rebellions instead of winning the war.
Sir, look... I can give you the coordinates of the largest cluster of life-forms. Maybe you can negotiate something.
But I need to send in the death squads soon. Your reputation may be secure, but mine isn't.
No one will know what happened on Isen Four until we're ready.
Very well; they all die.
You want them dead, I'll make them dead.
I can get rid of them.
Sir, it's--if they spread word, rebellions will start on half the captured planets. You can... buy us time to prepare.
Oxygen generators at these coordinates; distress beacons here. Eliminate them all, and death squads can take care of anyone left. We'll see you back home.
Systems unavailable.
Life support systems failing. Evacuate the colony immediately.
